page.title: 09THE ELY-ADELAIDE RAILWAY(ii)
page.content: Freight trains carry potatoes from Scotland,fresh fruit and vegetables from East Anglia and grain again from East Anglia.Each container for grain can take 58 tons.The fastest freight train can travel at 75 M.P.H.but its average speed is 60 M.P.H.The freight trains come from Whitemoor Yard at March which is their collecting point.Three Signalmen work in shifts.The shift hours are from 06.00 hours to 14.00 hours,14.00 hours to 22.00 hours and 22.00 hours to 06.00 hours.On Sundays two men work from 06.00 hours to 18.00 hours and from 18.00 hours to 06.00 hours.So that one of the three has a day off every third week.There is also a box lad who answers the telephone and records the trains' movements in a Log-Book.The signalmen travel from Chettisham and from Ely to work at Adelaide.
